articles.title: Winning Mega Millions Ticket Sold in Illinois for Growing $1.34 Billion Jackpot
articles.description: The total rose again Saturday, but it was not yet known who bought the $2 ticket in Illinois that matched all five winning numbers and the Mega Ball — 67, 45, 57, 36, 13 and 14.

articles.author: Aya Elamroussi, Andy Rose, Ray Sanchez
articles.title: Death toll rises to at least 25 in Kentucky flooding as people in stricken areas remain hard to reach, governor says
articles.description: The death toll in flood-stricken parts of eastern Kentucky climbed to at least 25 and will almost certainly "get worse" as first responders work to account for missing residents, the state's governor said Saturday.

articles.title: Who are the 7 House members who broke with their party in voting on assault weapons ban?
articles.description: Though the measure passed mostly along party lines, two Republicans and five Democrats broke with their parties on the vote.
articles.content:

articles.author: Michael D. Shear
articles.title: Biden Savors Much-Needed Victories. But Will the Highs Overshadow the Lows?
articles.description: With the midterm elections around the corner, the challenge for President Biden is to make sure his latest successes resonate with Americans who remain deeply skeptical about the future.
articles.content: The stimulus plan he pushed through at the beginning of his term distributed hundreds of billions of dollars to individuals and businesses in the midst of the pandemic. His $1 trillion bipartisan inf… [+1258 chars]

articles.author: Corley Peel
articles.title: 2 die when gyrocopter crashes, catches fire in Clay County, sheriff says
articles.description: Two people died Saturday morning when an experimental helicopter known as a gyrocopter crashed and caught fire on private property off County Road 214 in the Melrose area of Clay County, authorities said.

articles.title: Chinese nationalist commentator deletes Pelosi tweet after Twitter blocks account
articles.description: Prominent Chinese commentator Hu Xijin said on Saturday he deleted a tweet warning of military retaliation should U.S. fighter jets escort House Speaker Nancy Pelosi on any visit to Taiwan, after Twitter blocked his account.
